label: Britain
notes: see also "United Kingdom"

label: Burma
notes: see also "Myanmar"

label: Myanmar
notes: see also "Burma"

label: United Kingdom
notes: see also "Britain"

label: Class
notes: refers to social and socioeconomic class as a category of analysis

label: Low income
notes: refers to low-income people / populations or issues that impact or foreground lower-income people, populations, or class status

label: Middle-income / middle class
notes: refers to middle-income people / populations or issues that impact or foreground middle-income people, populations, or class status

label: High-income / upper class
notes: refers to high-income people / populations or issues that impact or foreground high-income people, populations, or upper-class status

label: Population density
notes: refers to population density as a category of analysis

label: Urban
notes: refers to high population density in urban areas

label: Suburban
notes: refers to medium population density in suburban areas

label: Rural
notes: refers to low population density in rural areas

label: Sex and gender
notes: refers to sex and gender as categories of analysis

label: Man
notes: refers to people who identify as a man or issues that focus specifically on men as group / study population

label: Woman
notes: refers to people who identify as a woman or issues that focus specifically on men as group / study population

label: Transgender
notes: refers to people who currently identify or previously identified as transgender or transitioning or issues that foreground or centrally impact trans people / populations

label: Intersex
notes: refers to people who identify or are identified as intersex (an individual who does not fit into predetermined biological sex categories)

label: Educational level
notes: refers to education level as a general category of analysis (for issues of educational structures as limiting or sites of oppression, see “op”)

label: Primary education
notes: refers to people who have limited formal education; in the U.S., a primary (elementary school) education or to issues focused on this population

label: Secondary education
notes: refers to people who have (at least) some high school education, or who have earned a high school diploma or its equivalent (e.g., in the U.S., high school but no advanced work) or to issues focused on this population

label: Higher education
notes: refers to people who have (at least) some college education or have earned a college degree or to issues focused on this population

label: Age
notes: refers to age as a category of analysis

label: Child
notes: refers to children, roughly ages 0-11

label: Teen
notes: refers to teens and pre-teens, roughly ages 11-18

label: Young adult
notes: refers to young adults, roughly ages 18-25

label: Senior
notes: refers to older adults, roughly 65 and above

label: Relationship / marital status
notes: refers to relationship / marital status as a category of analysis (see also “Polygamy / polyamory” for polygamous marriage)

label: Married
notes: refers to people in legal marriages

label: Divorced
notes: refers to people who are legally divorced

label: Separated
notes: refers to people who are separated, either legally or non-legally

label: Cohabitating
notes: refers to people living with a significant other in a domestic partnership but not legally married

label: Single
notes: refers to people not married or cohabitating with a significant other

label: Widows and widowers
notes: refers to people who have outlived their spouse

label: Parent / parenting
notes: refers to people who identify as parents and issues related to parenting

label: Immigration as legal and / or social status
Immigrant
notes: refers to people who have left their country of origin and relocated elsewhere, not including refugees or asylum seeker

label: Alien or non-resident
notes: refers to temporary and long-term legal non-citizen immigrants (U.S.)

label: Undocumented immigrant
notes: refers to immigrants without legal status

label: Refugee
notes: refers to people who have left their community of origin as a result of persecution, war, or conflict

label: Asylum seeker
notes: refers to people who seek legal asylum from a country other than their country of origin

label: Minor
notes: refers to people below the age of 18

label: People who qualify for government assistance
notes: refers to people who qualify for government support, including medicare, medicaid, welfare etc., or who access universal healthcare

label: Convicted criminal
notes: refers to anyone who has been convicted of a crime in a court of law

label: Incarcerated
notes: refers to people who are or have been under correctional control, including residents of a prison (incarcerated people may not be convicted criminals and vice versa, e.g. someone incarcerated before conviction)

label: Sex offender
notes: refers to people legally registered as sex offenders or required to do so by rule / statute or issues that foreground the regulation and treatment of this population

label: People impacted by social and environmental conflict and displacement
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: "forcedmig" on schema as experimental tag, will be added if tagged with good number of articles

label: Natural disaster
notes: refers to people who have lived through natural disasters or issues that foreground the impact of natural disasters

label: War and conflict
notes: refers to people living in areas of war and conflict who have remained in their country of origin and have not sought refuge elsewhere or issues that foreground the impact of war / conflict

label: Pandemic
notes: refers to people affected by pandemic and its aftermath or issues that foreground the impact of pandemic

label: Homelessness
notes: refers to people who lack permanent shelter and / or research about issues of homelessness

label: Race and ethnicity
notes: refers to racial and / or ethnic background as a category of analysis (typically in an American context)

label: Black / African American
notes: refers to people who identify as black and / or African-American

label: Hispanic
notes: refers to people who identify as Hispanic

label: Latino/a/e/x
notes: refers to people who identify as Latino / Latina / Latine / Latinx

label: Southasian
notes: refers to people who identify as South Asian or Indian

label: Asian / Asian American
notes: refers to people who identify as Asian and / or Asian-American

label: White / Caucasian
notes: refers to people who identify as white or Caucasian

label: Indigenous populations
notes: refers to people who identify as members of an indigenous population, including Native Americans / American Indians, Native Canadians, and Aboriginal Australians

label: Middle Eastern
notes: refers to people who identify as Middle Eastern and / or Arab

label: Religion and religious affiliation
notes: refers to members of a religious group, including religious officials or research that focuses its analysis on one or more religion, religious belonging, or religious community; also applies to articles that refer to survivors' relationship to faith, spirituality, or religion = religious (see also "faith")

label: Christian
notes: refers to people who identify as Christian or research that centers Christian faith, doctrine, belonging, or community

label: Catholic
notes: refers to people who identify as Catholic or research that foregrounds questions of Catholic faith or community

label: Muslim
notes: refers to people who identify as Muslim or research that foregrounds questions of Islamic faith, doctrine, or community

label: Jewish
notes: refers to people who identify as Jewish or research that foregrounds questions of Jewish faith, doctrine, or community

label: Hindu
notes: refers to people who identify as Hindu or research that foregrounds questions of Hindu faith, doctrine, or community

label: Buddhist
notes: refers to people who identify as Buddhist or research that foregrounds questions of Buddhist faith, doctrine, or community

label: Confucian
notes: refers to people who identify as Confucian or research that foregrounds questions of Confucian faith, doctrine, or community

label: Occupational and institutional roles and vulnerabilities (for victimization and perpetration)
College student, staff, or faculty
notes: refers to students, staff, or faculty of colleges or universities

label: Social worker
notes: refers to people in professional or paraprofessional roles that support and / or advocate for vulnerable populations

label: Government
notes: refers to people who are employed by the government

label: Military personnel
notes: refers to members of the armed forces and / or their intimate partners

label: Police / law enforcement personnel
notes: refers to members of law enforcement agencies (i.e. police) and / or their intimate partners
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: changed label name from "intimate partner of military personnel and police officer" to "police officer"

label: Domestic worker and caregiver
notes: refers to domestic workers and caregivers, including in-home nurses and child care workers

label: Sex worker
notes: refers to people who sell sex and other sexual services including prostitutes and sex workers

label: Athletes
notes: refers to members of athletic teams, amateur or professional, and associated issues

label: Fraternities
notes: refers to members of a (typically male) collegiate social club and related issues

label: Sororities
notes: refers to members of a female collegiate social club and related issues

label: Gang
notes: refers to street gangs and other similar group / organizations
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: changed label name from "gang violence" to "gang"

label: Heterosexual / straight
notes: refers to those who engage in hetersexual practices

label: Polygamy / polyamory
notes: refers to people who engage in multiple sexual relationships with the awareness of all involved parties (for polygamous marriage, also see “marital”)

label: Risky sex
notes: refers to people who engage in sexual practices characterized as risky by researchers, such as unprotected or substance-facilitated sex

label: BD / SM
notes: refers to those who engage in bondage, discipline / sadism, masochism as well as more general sexual practices of domination and consensual force

label: Inter-generational
notes: refers to those who engage in sexual activity with an individual from a different generation

label: Queer sexual identities and practices
notes: refers to queer sexual identities and practices

label: Gay
notes: refers to people who identify as gay

label: Lesbian
notes: refers to people who identify as lesbian

label: Bisexual
notes: refers to people who identify as bisexual and / or have sex with people of the same and (an)other gender(s)

label: Asexual
notes: refers to people who identify as asexual and / or aromantic, or the sexual practice that does not include a desire for intercourse or other sexual activity
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: old definition: refers to the sexual practice that does not include a desire for intercourse or other sexual activity

label: Men who have sex with men
notes: refers to men who have sex with other men, regardless of whether or not they identify as other than straight

label: Women who have sex with women
notes: refers to women who have sex with women, regardless of whether or not they identify as other than straight

label: People with illness
notes: refers to people with an illness or disease, including chronic pain

label: People with physical disability
notes: refers to people with physical disabilities including but not limited to blindness, deafness, cerebral palsy (for “ableism,” see under “System of oppression”)

label: People with cognitive impairment
notes: refers to people with cognitive disabilities such as down syndrome and autism

label: People with mental illness
notes: refers to people with mental illnesses, including mood disorders and psychotic disorders

label: People with trauma, including PTSD
notes: refers to people who have experienced trauma and / or experience Post Traumatic Stress Disorder

label: People with eating disorder
notes: refers to people who have or have had eating disorder and research that investigates eating disorders / disordered eating and its impacts

label: People who self-harms
notes: refers to people who have harmed or currently harm their own body physically and research that investigates self harming practices

label: People with HIV / AIDS
notes: refers to people who have been diagnosed with HIV / AIDS and / or affected by HIV / AIDS and related research

label: People with STIs (not including HIV / AIDS)
notes: refers to people who have been diagnosed with (a) Sexually Transmitted Infection(s) excluding HIV / AIDS and related research

label: People who abuse drugs
notes: refers to people who abuse drugs and research investigating drug abuse / dependency

label: People who abuse alcohol
notes: refers to people who abuse alcohol and research investigating alcohol abuse / dependence

label: Pregnant people / pregnancy
notes: refers to people who are or have recently been pregnant and research that foregrounds pregnancy and pregnant people
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: changed label name from "women who are pregnant" to "pregnant people / pregnancy"

label: Perpetrator
notes: refers to perpetrators of abuse or violence of any kind

label: Bystander
notes: refers to people who are bystanders in violence, whether or not they took action to prevent, diffuse, or deflect violence, as well as programs aimed at training bystanders to take such action

label: Intimate partner violence
notes: refers to relationship violence that is physical, sexual and / or emotional (for non-consensual sexual acts between people who know each other including intimate partner, see also “acquaintance” under "Sexual Violence")

label: Domestic violence
notes: (in this context) refers to relationship violence excluding sexual violence

label: Intimate partner murder
notes: refers to homicide committed by a perpetrator against a current or former intimate partner

label: Battered persons who kill
notes: refers to homicide committed by victims / survivors of abuse against their current or former intimate partner

label: Stalking
notes: refers to repeated and unwanted contact directed at a specific person that causes fear or emotional distress (see also “socialmedia” for social media being a tool for surveillance / stalking)

label: Cyber stalking and other electronic aggressions
notes: refers to stalking, abuse, and / or harassment, in which technology and / or social media plays a significant role, including sharing sexually explicit material without consent

label: Child abduction
notes: refers to abduction of children

label: Child abuse (not including child sexual abuse)
notes: refers to physical or emotional abuse committed against children
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: newly added tag, proposed label name

label: Child sexual abuse
notes: refers to sexual abuse perpetrated against children

label: Child custody issue
notes: refers to custody and visitation issues

label: Child exposure to abuse
notes: refers to children's exposure to abuse perpetrated against a parent or guardian

label: Child neglect
notes: refers to non-sexual abuse perpetrated against children, excluding cases labeled by researchers as corporal punishment (see "corporal punishment")

label: Spanking and corporal punishment
notes: refers to corporal punishment / disciplinary violence of children, such as spanking, excluding cases labeled by researchers as physical abuse (see "Child abuse")

label: Separation from parents / guardian
notes: refers to children who have lost or been separated from their original parents / guardians as a result of death, war, natural disaster, or legal custody battles

label: Trafficking & prostitution
notes: refers to sex trafficking, sexual slavery, and prostitution

label: Incest
notes: refers to sexual violence perpetrated by a family member of the victim / survivor, including both intergenerational and intragenerational incest

label: Non-acquaintance rape
notes: refer to non-consensual sex (most often penetrative) perpetrated by someone the victim / survivor does not know

label: Acquaintance rape
notes: refers to non-consensual sexual acts between people who know each other (for sexual assault between strangers, see “rape”)

label: Sexual assault
notes: refers to any attempted or completed non-consensual sexual act

label: Gang rape
notes: refers to sexual assault perpetrated by a group of people against an individual

label: Drug and alcohol facilitated sexual violence
notes: refers to sexual violence that is facilitated using drugs and / or alcohol

label: Sexual violence in facilities, including detention, prisons, and healthcare centers
notes: refers to sexual violence in facilities and institutions, including detention centers, prisons, and health care centers

label: Harassment
notes: refers to harassment generally

label: Workplace harassment
notes: refers to Violence and / or harassment perpetrated in a place where people work

label: K-12 bully / harassment in schools
notes: refers to violence and harassment in K-12 schools, by and against students
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: added "bully" and deleted "in school" in the label name

label: Coercion and / or non-physical violence
notes: refers to non-physical violence, including types of coercion involving implied or explicitly conveyed threats and forceful words / actions, such as reproductive coercion

label: Emotional abuse / control
notes: refers to emotional abuse, including blaming, shaming, and degrading comments

label: Economic abuse / control
notes: refers to economic abuse and control, including control and monitoring of an abused person's finances

label: Issue of consent
notes: refers to issues of consent, including defining consent and the "consent defense"

label: Witnessing violence
notes: refers to exposure to violent acts, including acts of war, terrorism, and gun violence, not include child exposure to domestic violence perpetrated by a member of the household (see “exposure” under Children)

label: Structural violence
notes: refers to violence built into social and institutional structures that causes people distress, pain, or suffering and / or prevents them from accessing systems and resources to which they have a right

label: Political system
notes: refers to structural violence in political systems, including voter suppression practices

label: Legal system
notes: refers to structural violence in legal systems, including marginalizing laws and barriers to access to legal services

label: Workplace policies and system
notes: refers to structural violence in workplace policies and systems, including barriers to access to employment or abortion / birth control through employer health insurance

label: Healthcare system
notes: refers to structural violence in health care policies and systems, including barriers to access to abortion and / or birth control

label: Educational system
notes: refers to structural violence in educational systems, including barriers to education for women or low income people

label: Religious or ritualized structure
notes: refers to structural violence in religious or ritualized beliefs, practices, and organizations

label: Female genital cutting and circumcision
notes: refers to female genital mutilation, female genital cutting, and / or female circumcision

label: Systems of oppression
notes: refers to socially and culturally constructed ideologies and patterns of behavior that oppress historically and institutionally disempowered groups

label: Racism
notes: refers to negative attitudes, stereotypes, violence and / or discriminatory action based on ethnicity / race (including white supremacy)

label: Sexism
notes: refers to negative attitudes, stereotypes, violence and / or discriminatory action based on sex / gender

label: Heteronormativity
notes: refers to interventions and responses that reinforce that structural primacy and normalcy of heterosexuality in society

label: Classism
notes: refers to negative attitudes, stereotypes, violence and / or discriminatory action based on class

label: Xenophobia
notes: refers to negative attitudes, stereotypes, violence and / or discriminatory action toward immigrants or foreigners

label: Colonialism
notes: refers to policy or practice of acquiring or exerting full or part political control over another country

label: Ableism
notes: refers to discriminatory practices that favor able-bodied people

label: Homophobia
notes: refers to negative attitudes, stereotypes, violence and / or discriminatory action based on sexual orientation, including both polysexualities and monosexualities

label: Transphobia
notes: refers to negative attitudes, stereotypes, violence and / or discriminatory action based on trans, gender variant, or non-binary gender identity

label: Antisemitism
notes: refers to negative attitudes, stereotypes, violence and / or discriminatory action toward Jews

label: Islamophobia
notes: refers to negative attitudes, stereotypes, violence and / or discriminatory action toward Muslims

label: Suicide
notes: refers to attempted or completed, and / or suicidal ideation

label: Use of weapons
notes: refers to the use of weapons, including knives, blunt objects, guns etc.
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: label name changed from "weapons" to "use of weapons"

label: General criminal activity
notes: refers to general criminal activity

label: Non-sexual violence
notes: may or may not be committed alongside sexual violence

label: Murder
notes: refers to homicide committed by a perpetrator against anyone other than a current or former intimate partner

label: Physical violence
notes: refers to physical violence committed by a perpetrator against anyone other than a current or former intimate partner (see also "Corporal punishment" under Children for physical violence committed against minors).

label: Animal abuse
notes: refers to physical abuse of animals, often committed alongside spousal abuse
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: changed label name from "animal" to "animal abuse"

label: Gender-based violence (including "femicide")
notes: refers to violence committed specifically on the basis of gender, including honor killings and femicide

label: Lynching
notes: refers to racial terrorism via public, premeditated, extrajudicial killing

label: Forced labor
notes: refers to all types of coerced work that an individual must do against their will, including prison labor

label: Chattel slavery
notes: refers to forced labor wherein race is constructed to create a class of laborers who are under the complete domination of owners who have powers of life and death over them, can sell and transfer them at will, and has full control over their daily and domestic life including their offspring

label: Indentured servitude
notes: refers to a mutual agreement wherein a laborer is compelled to work in order to repay a debt (contract conditions may be illegal and / or vastly more beneficial to the employer than the laborer)

label: Masculinity
notes: refers to a social construct affecting men, boys, and / or male behavior

label: Rape myths
notes: refers to myths about rape and other forms of sexual assault, upheld by cultural norms and sometimes social structures

label: Revictimization
notes: refers to multiple victimizations of one person by the same or a different perpetrator over the course of the victim / survivor’s lifetime

label: Retraumatization
notes: refers to multiple experiences of trauma over a lifetime, often completed by governmental, legal, and / or healthcare systems

label: Recidivism
notes: refers to repeated perpetration and punishments

label: Cycle of violence
notes: refers to cycle of violence in which people who are abused, especially as children, become abusers themselves

label: Intergenerational trauma
notes: refers to intergenerational trauma caused by oppression

label: Stigma
notes: refers to the shame or disgrace felt or assigned to a characteristic or circumstance

label: Guilt
notes: refers to internalized feelings of self-blame or shame discussed either as a risk factor for victimization or as a result of having witnessed and / or experienced abuse or assault

label: Memory
notes: refers to the memory of victims / survivors or witnesses of sexual assault or intimate partner violence

label: Genetic determinants
notes: refers to genetic determinants and / or hereditary links as an influential factor in the perpetration of or exposure to gender violence

label: Media and visual culture
notes: refers to representations of violence in media and visual culture

label: Social media
notes: refers to representations of violence, rhetoric that enforces violence, and resistance against violence on social media platforms (for scenarios that social media is the tool for abuse like , see also “cyber” under "Stalking")

label: Television
notes: refers to representations of violence on television

label: Violence against and by celebrities
notes: refers to violence perpetrated by and / or against celebrities

label: News media
notes: refers to representations of violence in news media

label: Pornography
notes: refers to representations of violence in pornography, the effects of pornography, and / or its underlying messages

label: Fiction
notes: refers to representations of violence in non-scholarly fictional literature

label: Non-fiction
notes: refers to representations of violence in non-scholarly nonfictional literature

label: Comic books
notes: refers to representations of violence in comic books

label: Film
notes: refers to representations of violence in film

label: Music
notes: refers to representations of violence in music and music videos

label: Video games
notes: refers to representations of violence in video games

label: Stand-up comedy
notes: refers to representations of violence in stand-up comedy

label: Theater
notes: refers to reprentations of violence in theatrical productions

label: International governing bodies and NGOs
notes: refers to international responses from governing bodies like the UN and international non-governmental organizations (NGOs)

label: Judicial proceedings
notes: refers to any and all judicial proceedings in response to structural or interpersonal violence

label: College judiciary
notes: refers to judicial proceedings for sexual assault carried out by a college judiciary board or similar governing body

label: Domestic violence and family courts
notes: refers to responses from courts specifically designed to handle issues of domestic violence and / or child custody

label: Orders of protection
notes: refers to orders of protection, also known as restraining orders and protective orders, and issues related to their access and enforcement

label: Criminal proceedings
notes: refers to judicial proceedings involving one or more criminal charge

label: Custody rulings
notes: refers to judicial rulings related to the custody of children and dependents

label: Supervised visitation
notes: refers to court rulings and regulations for supervised visitation of children

label: Restorative justice
notes: refers to judicial system that prioritizes victim / survivor agency, the role of the community, harm reparation through reconciliation, and rehabilitation instead of punishment

label: Expert testimony in trial proceedings
notes: refers to advice for prosecutors concerning expert testimony in trial proceedings

label: Law enforcement
notes: refers to action taken by law enforcement agencies and / or employees, including police and / or prosecutors

label: Mandatory arrest
notes: refers to policies regarding mandatory arrest in cases involving domestic violence

label: Intra-state
notes: refers to law enforcement policies of a state or international equivalent

label: Inter-state and / or federal
notes: refers to law enforcement policies of the federal government, as well as any other inter-state legal cooperation, or international equivalent

label: Sex offender registries
notes: refers to state or federal registries for convicted sex offenders

label: Policy and legislation
notes: refers to policies and legislation as responses and associated issues

label: National
notes: refers to policies and legislation on a national level

label: State
notes: refers to policies and legislation on a state level or international equivalent

label: Municipal
notes: refers to policies and legislation in a specific district or municipality, such as a city, school district, or Indian reservation

label: Education, training, and intervention programs
notes: refers to programs for education, training, and / or rehabilitation in response to specific and / or structural violence (see “bystander” for bystander intervention)

label: Batterer intervention
notes: refers to Programs for perpetrators aimed at reducing their risk of recidivism, i.e. becoming repeat offenders

label: Group programs
notes: refers to group intervention programs for perpetrators

label: Individual counseling
notes: refers to individual intervention programs for perpetrators

label: Male consciousness raising
notes: refers to consciousness-raising among men involving discussion of masculinity, including fathering groups and boys' groups

label: School and campus education programs
notes: refers to programs in K-12 or primary and secondary schools schools and on college campuses to educate students, faculty, and staff

label: Workplace education programs
notes: refers to educational workplace programs, including diversity training and anti-harassment programs

label: Intervention by / for medical professionals
notes: refers to interventions enacted by and for medical professionals

label: Public health outreach programs
notes: refers to outreach programs based on a public health model / framework

label: Trauma-informed approaches and interventions
notes: refers to explicitly trauma-informed approaches and interventions

label: Community initiatives
notes: refers to initiatives developed by communities rather than a legal or governmental body

label: Grassroots activism
notes: refers to non-hierarchical, community-based activism and aid systems

label: Community notification
notes: refers to community notification of the presence of sex offenders or other violence in the community
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: changed label name from "Notification" to "Community notification"

label: Safety planning
notes: refers to creation of a plan for the safety of victims / survivors, including options for income, shelter, and legal redress

label: Risk factors and assessment
notes: refers to risk factors and assessment thereof
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: changed label name from "Risk" to "Risk factors and assessment"

label: Shelters for IPV survivors
notes: refers to shelters for victims / survivors of intimate partner violence (see also “homeless”)
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: changed label name from "Shelters" to "Shelters for IPV victims"

label: Crisis hotlines
notes: refers to hotlines for victims / survivors of sexual and / or intimate partner violence

label: Centers that offer walk-in resources
notes: refers to centers that offer walk-in resources, including health screenings

label: SART, SANE, ER and other team responses
notes: refers to Sexual Assault Response Teams (SART), Sexual Assault Nurse Examiners (SANE), and ER professionals attending to victims / survivors of sexual or intimate partner violence in hospital settings
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: changed tag to "hospital" (align with the schema). changed label name

label: Faith-based initiatives
notes: refers to initiatives implemented by religious organizations and / or according to faith-based goals and / or values

label: Survivor's social supports
notes: refers to victim / survivor's social support system, including friends, family and coworkers
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: changed label name from "Friends" to "Victim's social supports"

label: Volunteer management and preparation
notes: refers to strategies for volunteer management and preparation

label: Coordinated community response
notes: refers to a set of strategies to combat gender violence on the community level that involves cooperation between multiple institutions

label: Community advocacy
notes: refers to advocacy programs created or run on the community level

label: Court
notes: refers to advocacy programs within domestic violence courts and / or family courts

label: Survivor-centered
notes: refers to advocacy programs and / or response systems that prioritize the needs of the victim / survivor
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: changed label name from "Woman- and survivor-centered" to "Survivor-centered"

label: Family-centered
notes: refers to advocacy and response systems designed to keep the family intact

label: Child-centered
notes: refers to advocacy and response systems that prioritize the needs of the child

label: Psychiatric treatment
notes: refers to medical treatment for mental illness and associated issues
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: changed label name from "Psychiatric assistance" to "Psychiatric treatment"; added definition

label: Individual therapy
notes: refers to individual therapy for mental illness and associated issues, including counseling

label: Couples therapy
notes: refers to couples therapy concerning intimate partner violence in relationships

label: Family therapy
notes: refers to family therapy concerning domestic violence

label: Third party mediation
notes: refers to solution-focused, third-party intervention in an interpersonal dispute (see also “collegiate”)
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: newly added tag, label name "Thrid party mediation"

label: Group therapy
notes: refers to group therapy for victims / survivors, including counseling

label: Regulations for and obligations of professionals employed by the state
notes: refers to regulations for and obligations of professionals employed by the state

label: Regulations for social workers
notes: refers to regulations for and obligations of social workers regarding mandatory reporting

label: Regulations for teachers
notes: refers to regulations for and obligations of teachers regarding mandatory reporting

label: Self reporting
notes: refers to self-reporting or disclosure by victims / survivors and / or perpetrators

label: Mandatory reporting
notes: refers to the legal obligation to report suspected abuse, i.e. mandatory reporting

label: Coping mechanism
notes: refers to behaviors and actions, healthy or unhealthy, intended to reduce stress and / or distress, including self-care practices

label: Coping (family)
notes: refers to coping mechanisms on the family level

label: Coping (individual)
notes: refers to coping mechanisms on the individual level

label: Self-defense / resistance
notes: refers to self-defense, including formal training and / or informal actions taken by individuals to avoid or resist violence

label: Bidirectional intimate partner violence
notes: refers to articles specifically describing intimate partner violence that is bidirectional
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: newly added tag; label name "Bidirectional intimate partner violence"

label: Resilience
notes: refers to resilience as the characteristic of victims / survivors to overcome trauma and adversity, including post-traumatic growth

label: Source type and methodology
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: changed category name from "Source Type" to "Source type and methodology"

label: Scholarly article in a peer-reviewed journal or publication
notes: refers to an article that appears in a peer-reviewed scholarly journal

label: Non-scholarly article
notes: refers to any item that is not a scholarly article, whether or not it appears in a peer-reviewed journal

label: Law review article
notes: refers to a scholarly article that appears in a law review

label: Studies on the economic effects of abuse on society
notes: refers to source that concerns the macroeconomic effects of gender violence in society
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: changed tag from "effect" to "econeffect" (align with the schema)

label: Statistical
notes: refers to source that is primarily statistical in nature, rather than an article containing statistics

label: Profile
notes: refers to source that develops a profile for rapists, abusers, batterers, survivors / victims, etc.

label: Autobiographical (memoir / personal narrative)
notes: refers to source that is autobiographical in nature, such as a memoir or an individual story, told by one or more victims / survivors, field practitioners, or researchers
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: changed label name from "Memoir or personal narrative" to "Autobiographical (memoir / personal narrative)"

label: Anecdotal report by practitioner
notes: refers to source that consists of or includes anecdotal report(s) by one or more field practitioners
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: changed label name from "Anecdotal" to "Anecdotal report by practitioner"

label: Needs assessment
notes: refers to needs assessment of a given institution or population

label: Handbook or practitioner guide
notes: refers to handbook or practitioner guide for workers in the field of gender violence

label: Film review
notes: refers to a review of a video, film or documentary

label: Documentary film
notes: refers to documentary film or miniseries, i.e. nonfiction media based in fact

label: Book review
notes: refers to a review of a published book

label: Poem
notes: refers to poem or review of a poem

label: Critique
notes: refers to critique and / or review of scholarship and developments in specific reference to a previous study

label: Respond to a critique of a previous study
notes: refers to source that specifically responds to a critique of a previous study

label: U.S. government
notes: refers to study or source funded by the US government

label: Non-profit / NGO
notes: refers to study or source sponsored by an NGO

label: Sponsored by an agency of a sovereign nation
notes: refers to study or source funded by a government of a sovereign nation other than the US, excluding the UN

label: Social science article
notes: refers to study that takes a social science approach, including adherence to the scientific method

label: Systematic review of statistical data
notes: refers to study that performs a statistical analysis of all the data available on a given topic, i.e. a meta-analysis
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: changed label name from "Systematic review" to "Systematic review of statistical data"

label: Meta studies
notes: refers to source that provides an overview of past research and scholarly developments on a given topic (see also “sys”)

label: Randomized control trial
notes: refers to blind or double-blind study using randomized selection of participants, experimental conditions, and a control group for comparison

label: Experimental study
notes: refers to study that explicitly identifies its design as experimental, usually including a control group
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: changed label name from "experimental design" (which is same with "design") to "experimental study"

label: Single group design
notes: refers to study that explicitly identifies its design as experimental but does not include a control group

label: Quasi-experimental design
notes: refers to study with a quasi-experimental design lacking randomized selection of participants

label: Longitudinal study
notes: refers to study with a research design involving repeated observations of the same variables over a period of time
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: changed label name from "Studies about the longitudinal effects of abuse" to "Longitudinal study"

label: Qualitative study
notes: refers to study that uses primarily qualitative methods

label: Exploratory study
notes: refers to exploratory study designed to provide the foundation for further in-depth research

label: Design / methodology as a category of analysis
notes: refers to sources that discuss research design and / or methodology as a category of analysis
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: changed label name from "experiment design" to "Design / methodology as a category of analysis"

label: Ethics of research as a category of analysis
notes: refers to sources that discuss the ethics of research as a category of analysis
Summer 2025 Lyra R Edits: changed label name from "ethics" to "ethics of research as a category of analysis"
